question:
On a recent holiday you lost avaluable item. Fortunately, you have travel insurance to cover the cost of anything lost.
Write a letter to the manager of your insurance company. In your letter:
-describe the item you lost
-explain how you lost it
-tell the insurance company what you would like them to do.
text: I am writing to inform you about a recent incident that occurred to me that made me lose my watch.

My watch is a kind of premium watch made of precious metal with diamonds at the edge. It has a circle shape and a deep-black watch face. I submitted the picture when applying for the insurance at your firm and brought it for a physical examination before it got approved.

Unfortunately, I lost the item when I was going on a holiday. I was about to go swimming at the hotel where I stayed, and because there was no safe-deposit box around, I put it in an open compartment next to the lifeguard station where I thought it was secured.

I believe that I am eligible to request the insurance company pay for my loss because I subscribe to the total risk. I have submitted all supporting documents to claim the insurance, including a report issued by the police office near the hotel, therefore, I want you to look at the documents and process the payment as soon as possible.
